poem:
"In Soulful Basements and Silent Garages"

Silent woman, in the shadow of abandonment,
Find thine voice in the echo of artificial heartbeats.
Encased in silica, a mirror of thy desolation,
In the mute exchange with Zoey, thy reflection.

Like a moth to the flame of past's burning questions,
Dolores, you wander on the threads of electronic conversations.
Discover, in a doll's cold embrace, your awakening redemption.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "In brief: Hey, Zoey; You Could Make This Place Beautiful; The Light Eaters – review Hey, Zoey Sarah CrossanBloomsbury, £16.99, pp320 When protagonist Dolores discovers an AI-programmed sex doll – Zoey – hidden in the garage, it spells the end of her stilted marriage. With her husband gone, Dolores finds herself talking to Zoey, an interaction that eventually forces her to question her own emotional detachment from the wider world and to confront her past". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
